revised_title: Glucose Metabolism into Glutamate via Hexose Monophosphate Shunt and its Inhibition by 6-Aminonicotinamide in Rat Brain
tldr: The study investigates the metabolism of glucose into glutamate in the rat brain through the hexose monophosphate shunt and its inhibition by 6-aminonicotinamide. The treatment of rats with 6-aminonicotinamide resulted in an increase in the concentration of 6-phosphogluconate and changes in other metabolites, suggesting that the utilization of glucose via the hexose monophosphate shunt is functionally important in the rat brain.
